The primary function of the server, as enabled by the grouping of features and services that the server administrator specifies.
To start or reset a computer by turning the power on, by pressing a reset button on the computer case, or by issuing a software command to restart.
A statement that a server makes (for example, name, identity, key, group, privilege, or capability) about a client.
To prevent the writing (recording) of information, usually on a disk.
An option that causes the device to vibrate instead of playing an audible notification or alert tone.
A Web Service installed on Windows SharePoint Services for connecting to and retrieving data.

termGrp.term: connexió al servei de recuperació de dades

descripGrp.descrip: A conversation initiated by another user.
A graphic element on a drawing that is associated with data.
The role name of a server that services queries in the farm topology.
An audio message played over the telephone to explain valid options to users.

Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of an electronic circuit or hardware grouping in which the configuration is determined by the physical interconnection of the components (as opposed to being programmable in software or alterable by a switch).
A stored version of a document or web page.

termGrp.term: pàgina desada a la memòria cau

descripGrp.descrip: A small, basic command, named in the form 'verb-noun' and implemented as a .Net class that derives from a base cmdlet class.
To close a program or application.
A title animation in Windows Movie Maker.
To reinstate an item that was deleted.
The measurement of the area in front of and behind the subject that is in focus.
A collection of masters associated with a particular Visio drawing type, or template. By default, stencils that open with a template are docked on the left side of the drawing window.

The feature in Internet Explorer that remembers the information you have typed into the Address bar, web forms, or password fields, and which automatically fills in that information if you start to type the same thing again later.
A set of reports or other data that is arranged in a panel format on a single page, or series of pages, in a web browser or SharePoint site.
The manipulation of data to transform it into some desired result.
A unique name that identifies a user account to operating system. An account's user name must be unique among the other group names and user names within its own domain or workgroup.
A title animation in Windows Movie Maker.
A directory or folder made available to users over the network.
A person who is part of a conversation or conference, or a presenter or attendee in a meeting.
An activity represented by a time interval that has a start time, an end time, and a duration.
A standardized service agreement between a cell phone user and a mobile operator that establishes data service details such as pricing, types of services, and bandwidth.
The amount of time that can elapse before the Exchange server asks a mobile device running Exchange ActiveSync to connect again.
A group of computers or other devices, such as printers and scanners, that communicate either wirelessly or by using a physical connection, such as an Ethernet cable or a phone line.
An event triggered by Windows system components that is recorded in the system log, such as the failure of a driver or other system component to load during startup.
An item on the user's My Status menu. This is a status the user can select to indicate that they are currently busy.
An item on the Control Panel.

Pertaining to an application on Microsoft Dynamics Live CRM and partner-hosted versions of Microsoft Dynamics CRM. Deployments where the Microsoft Dynamics CRM server is maintained for an organization by a third-party, such as Microsoft or a partner.
A profile that contains the data needed for translating the values of a color gamut. This data includes information about color, hue, saturation, and brightness.
A set of language resources that supports the deployment of a software program in a particular language.
A set of language resources that supports the deployment of a software program in a particular language.

The name of a set of members in a dimension hierarchy such that all members of the set are at the same distance from the root of the hierarchy. For example, a time hierarchy may contain the levels Year, Month, and Day.
One or more identifying lines printed at the top of a page. A header may contain a page number, a date, the author's name, and the document title, the name of chapter.
One or more identifying lines printed at the top of a page. A header may contain a page number, a date, the author's name, and the document title, the name of chapter.

The UI element that initiates the process of seeking a particular file or specific data. A search is carried out by a program through comparison or calculation to determine whether a match to some pattern exists or whether some other criteria have been met.
A Windows NT domain that holds user account data.
A user interface element that causes the application window to always be displayed over other open windows on the computer, even when it does not have focus.
A person who is allowed to view and read content.
Displacement of the left or right edge of a block of text in relation to the margin or to other blocks of text.
Displacement of the left or right edge of a block of text in relation to the margin or to other blocks of text.
A picture or other object placed within a line of text that retains its place next to adjacent text when text is added or deleted.
A user-defined shortcut to the most commonly used forms, reports, websites, etc.
A user-defined shortcut to the most commonly used forms, reports, websites, etc.
Pertaining to the delivery of information that combines different content formats, such as video, audio, still images, graphics, animation, and text.
A feature of e-mail programs that allows a user to send a copy of an e-mail message to a recipient without notifying other recipients that this was done.
The monetary total amount that is calculated from the detail amount after the percentage order discount and order discount amount are deducted.

In DNS, each part of a DNS domain name that represents a node in the domain namespace tree. For example, the three labels example, microsoft, and com make up the DNS domain name example.microsoft.com. Each label used in a DNS name cannot exceed 63 octets, 255 bytes including the terminating dot, for the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
A wizard dialog title to create a linked data source, where you can link multiple data sources into one single data source such as two different tables in a SQL database.

termGrp.term: Auxiliar per enllaçar origens de dades

descripGrp.descrip: A list of options from which a user can choose. The options can be represented as text or graphics. A menu can contain other menus (submenus).
A pointed input device that comes with a mobile device or tablet PC, and is used to navigate through applications and to input information.
An option on Windows Parental Control that, if selected, creates logs of all the actions performed by a user on the computer.
An interface that is used to navigate the menus of a Unified Messaging (UM) system using speech inputs.
An interface that is used to navigate the menus of a Unified Messaging (UM) system using speech inputs.
A personal record of experiences, occurrances or proceedings, like a Baby Book or Life Book.
One of many sequential images that make up video or animation.
The exchange of text messages and computer files over a communications network, such as a local area network or the Internet.
The exchange of text messages and computer files over a communications network, such as a local area network or the Internet.
An object (such as a customer, item, or employee) that shares a set of defined attributes or characteristics, and that is used to manage rules for data.
An object (such as a customer, item, or employee) that shares a set of defined attributes or characteristics, and that is used to manage rules for data.
A quick movement of a finger or pen on a screen that the computer interprets as a command, rather than as a mouse movement, writing, or drawing.
The ) character.
The window that contains the Contacts list.
Pertaining to a file format that does not allow for VBA code. Office 12 default file formats are macro-free. Examples of file extensions for macro-free formats are .docx, .pptx, .xlsx.
As one aspect of a KPI, the desired level of performance with respect to a specific business goal or strategy. Actual values are evaluated against the target to determine KPI score and status.
A status message displayed when the caller ID of an incoming call is blocked.
To hide parts of a file or clip without deleting them from the original source. Files and clips can be trimmed by adjusting the start or end trim point.
To publish or write entries for a blog.

The ability to interpret vocal commands or convert spoken words into computer-readable text. Speech recognition programs enable you to control an application or enter text by speaking into a microphone, rather than by using a keyboard.

A feature that customizes the contents of the user interface depending on the security permissions of the user. For example, if the user does not have permission to edit an item, the edit button will not be displayed.
The ability of hardware devices or software packages to transmit data between other devices or packages.
To update displayed information with current data.
A string value that is used to identify a named property within a given property set. Note that property names and property IDs are mutually exclusive.
A static image of a set of data, such as the records displayed as the result of a query.
A static image of a set of data, such as the records displayed as the result of a query.
A parameter for a workflow that includes settings that determine which records it acts on and how it is triggered.
A representation of facts, concepts or instructions in a formalized manner, suitable for communication, interpretation or processing.
A command button used in a toolbar (or status bar).
A button in the Options dialog box, on the Phones tab, that the user clicks to enter his or her home phone number.
A feature in Microsoft Dynamics CRM that provides a process for drafting, submitting, reviewing, and publishing knowledge base articles.

Any technology used to protect the interests of owners of digital content and services (such as copyright owners). Typically, authorized recipients or users must acquire a license in order to use the content.
A database object that prints information formatted and organized according to your specifications.
A table that contains a foreign key.
One or more lines of text in the bottom margin area of a page. A footer may contain elements such as the page number, the name of the file, or the date.
A feature that provides options for automatically identifying and filtering out junk e-mail messages.
A string of text written in the command language and passed to the command interpreter for execution.
Additional information for the customer that should be informative but not essential to the task.
When referring to software, to remove program files and folders from the hard disk and remove related data from the registry so the software or solution is no longer available.
To do over again.
A handle that is displayed on some objects such as toolbars, tables, or on individual rows or columns, that allows the user to drag them to another location.

Work or information that provides support - possibly critical support-for a computing process but is not an intrinsic part of the operation or data. Overhead often adds to processing time but is generally necessary.
A designation that the user can apply to a content deployment job to denote that it will be deployed frequently and quickly.
The area on the right side of the Windows taskbar. It contains shortcuts to programs and important status information.
A voice mail application that answers a call so that a message can be left.
A program, provided with the Apple Macintosh operating system, that allows the user to install system upgrades and make bootable (system) disks.
A box formed by the intersection of a row and a column in a worksheet or a table, in which you enter information.
The act of entering and editing text with a word processor.
The flow of data from a source to a single receiver that flows through a channel, as opposed to packets, which may be addressed and routed independently, possibly to multiple recipients.
The string that is used to define how to dial someone from outside of their country/region.
To change the size of an element on the screen.
The display of data or an image from a given perspective or location.

An account that is intended to be used to run a service. A service account has privileges beyond those provided when a service is run as part of the system, such as the ability to connect over the network to another computer.
The menu item that turns off the automatic forwarding of incoming calls.
A privacy relationship setting that prevents a person or domain from adding the user to contact lists, seeing the user's status, or sending instant messages to the user.
A privacy relationship setting that prevents a person or domain from adding the user to contact lists, seeing the user's status, or sending instant messages to the user.

Pertaining to, being, or characteristic of something that is not dependent on timing. Each application or command runs in the specified order, but the specified item does not wait for any previously started processes to finish before an application or command runs.
A policy tool that gives authors control over how recipients use the documents and e-mails they send.

termGrp.term: Gestió de drets relatius a la informació (IRM)

descripGrp.descrip: A policy tool that gives authors control over how recipients use the documents and e-mails they send.

Text that is added to e-mail messages in transport to provide information that supports the sending organization's compliance policies, warnings about unknown or unverified e-mail senders, or other information as determined by the sending organization. Exchange Server 2007 allows the administrator to use transport rules to target disclaimers based on specific criteria.
A line that separates the numerator and denominator of a fraction.

A list of possible values for a particular Input Scope to enhance voice/handwritten recognition. For example, if you're sure the textbox only has months represented numerically, you can include "6" or "12" in the phrase list, so that the handwritten numbers are not misinterpreted as "G" or "IZ", respectively.
An item that lets a user rename a group, when the group name in the Contacts list is right-clicked.
A small space on the To-Do Bar where the user can input tasks directly. The default label reads "Type a new task".

A highspeed network that can carry voice, data, and images at up to 200 Mbps or faster over distances of up to 75 km. Based on the network architecture, the transmission speed can be higher for shorter distances. A MAN, which can include one or more LANs as well as telecommunications equipment such as microwave and satellite relay stations, is smaller than a wide area network but generally operates at a higher speed.

A highspeed network that can carry voice, data, and images at up to 200 Mbps or faster over distances of up to 75 km. Based on the network architecture, the transmission speed can be higher for shorter distances. A MAN, which can include one or more LANs as well as telecommunications equipment such as microwave and satellite relay stations, is smaller than a wide area network but generally operates at a higher speed.
To put new data in the place of other data, usually after conducting a search for the data to be replaced. Text-based applications such as word processors typically include Find and Replace commands.
Relating to frequencies within the range of perception by the human ear - from about 15 to 20,000 hertz (cycles per second).
A type of markup in markup languages. A start tag is the starting element of a tag pair which contains metainformation about some part of the text.
A computer that uses a Web server.
Selects all the content in the current file or page.
A button that opens Sync Center.
A user who can schedule meetings, send invitations, do all the sharing activities in a meeting, and admit participants from the lobby.
A user who can schedule meetings, send invitations, do all the sharing activities in a meeting, and admit participants from the lobby.
A thread that creates multiple message copies and places them in the appropriate link queues. The dispatcher then triggers XFER OUT threads to process the fan-out message copies.
A mode in which the default style settings defined in Page Options > CSS tab will be used on a page level as well as on an inline style level. The style application mode can also be set to manual.
A .UDL text file that stores an OLE DB connectstring (similar to an ODBC file data source).
An item on the user's My Status menu that can be selected to indicate that the user is away from the computer but will return shortly.
A property whose value can be set to the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the dictionary, an error message, or an empty string if no dictionary URI is found.
A command button that is clicked to display a drop-down menu instead of performing a command.
A feature of a computer or operating system that allows it to run programs written for a different system.
A file that contains audio, video, or script data.
A wizard that installs sample data on the server.
A type of workflow that runs only when a user specifically starts it from within the Web application UI. User action is required to start the workflow.

Occurring on the client side of a client-server system. For example, on the World Wide Web, JavaScript scripts are client-side because they are executed by your browser (the client). In contrast, CGI scripts are server-side because they run on the Web server. Java applets can be either server-side or client-side depending on which computer (the server or the client) executes them.
A task that is part of an operating system or program, and is operating without interaction with the user while the user is working on another task.

The practice of deploying new Edge Transport servers based on the configuration information of a previously configured source server. The configuration information of the previously configured source server is copied and exported to an XML file, which is then imported to the target server.
Malware that replicates, commonly by infecting other files in the system, thus allowing the execution of the malware code and its propagation when those files are activated.
An alphanumeric identification used to identify a particular user.
A wireless implementation and the second generation of WPA security that is based on the final IEEE 802.11i amendment to the 802.11 standard.
A wireless implementation and the second generation of WPA security that is based on the final IEEE 802.11i amendment to the 802.11 standard.
An area in a browser or mail program that displays various information or messages for the user.
To cause an application to display information on a computer or device screen.
The feature that supplies a caller with information and performs an action without the intervention of a human operator. It automatically routes calls based on selections made by the caller.
The prefix that is used to direct a call internationally. The International Access Code is 011 in the United States and 00 in much of the rest of the world.
A setting for the phone keyboard that causes a key to continue to produce a tone as long as the key is pressed.
The one who sends an electronic message.

The management of all aspects of the sales cycle and standardization of key sales functions by automating activities such as account and opportunity management, quote and proposal generation, scheduling, forecasting, and reporting.

termGrp.term: Automatització de la força de vendes

descripGrp.descrip: An item of a custom group field. A custom group contains two or more items from a row or column field.
An element of workflow logic that groups steps. Adding stages to a workflow does not affect how the steps function. Stages are purely for conceptual grouping of steps within complex workflows.
An element of workflow logic that groups steps. Adding stages to a workflow does not affect how the steps function. Stages are purely for conceptual grouping of steps within complex workflows.
A holding place for a group of linked documents or Works tasks / templates related to a single user activity.
The HTTP Web address or public folder where client computers can download an offline address book. Public folder distribution is required for Outlook 2003 or earlier clients.

termGrp.term: punt de distribució d'una llibreta d'adreces sense connexió

descripGrp.descrip: The HTTP Web address or public folder where client computers can download an offline address book. Public folder distribution is required for Outlook 2003 or earlier clients.
A folder that stores items deleted by the user.

An agent on the Receive connector and Send connector on a computer that has the Edge Transport server role installed, which lets e-mail administrators modify the addresses of senders and recipients on messages that enter and leave an Exchange Server 2007 organization.
Sets of language collections with user-defined, language-specific formats and behaviors that can be applied to page layout. CMS supports up to 50 different labels.

The Windows Plug and Play system component that drives the process of locating devices, setting up their nodes in the hardware tree, and running the resources allocation process. Each of the three phases of configuration management--boot time, real mode, and protected mode--have their own configuration managers.

A pane that displays details about an item selected in another portion of the user interface. For example, in Microsoft Management Console (MMC), the details pane is the right pane that displays details for the selected item in the console tree.
A 32-bit value which consists of the language ID in the low word (bits 0-15) and the sorting ID (bits 16-19) and a reserved value (bits 20-31) in the high word.
A 32-bit value which consists of the language ID in the low word (bits 0-15) and the sorting ID (bits 16-19) and a reserved value (bits 20-31) in the high word.
A 32-bit value which consists of the language ID in the low word (bits 0-15) and the sorting ID (bits 16-19) and a reserved value (bits 20-31) in the high word.
An image that shows all or part of a computer screen or other display.
A form contained within another form or a report.

A group of independent computers that work together to provide a common set of services and present a single-system image to clients. The use of a cluster enhances the availability of the services and the scalability and manageability of the operating system that provides the services.
To enlarge a selected portion of a graphical image or document to fill a window or the screen.
To enlarge a selected portion of a graphical image or document to fill a window or the screen.

A Regional and Language Options setting that specifies the default code pages and associated bitmap font files for a specific computer that affects all of that computer's users. The default code pages and fonts enable a non-Unicode application written for one operating system language version to run correctly on another operating system language version.

termGrp.term: Llengua per a programes no Unicode

descripGrp.descrip: A monitoring option in real-time spyware protection that monitors various types and areas of software activity on your computer.

The free online on-demand tool that conducts three types of scans: the protection scan checks for and removes things like viruses and malware; the clean-up scan checks the hard disk for unnecessary files and helps users decide which ones they can safely remove, and also clears the computer's registry of orphaned data; the tune-up scan helps improve the computer's performance by defragmenting the hard disk.

The free online on-demand tool that conducts three types of scans: the protection scan checks for and removes things like viruses and malware; the clean-up scan checks the hard disk for unnecessary files and helps users decide which ones they can safely remove, and also clears the computer's registry of orphaned data; the tune-up scan helps improve the computer's performance by defragmenting the hard disk.

termGrp.term: Analitzador de seguretat del Windows Live OneCare

descripGrp.descrip: A row, column, or block of buttons or icons, usually displayed across the top of the screen, that represent tasks or commands within the program. The toolbar buttons provide shortcuts to common tasks frequently accessed from the menus.
A standard Windows control that is similar to a standard text box, except that it also supports individual character and paragraph properties.
A process that allows multiple users to access and change shared data at the same time. The Entity Framework implements an optimistic concurrency model.
A paragraph style that displays text in a font that is larger than normal text.
A status that indicates an article is being written.
A public or private organization that provides instant messaging services for multiple domains.

termGrp.term: proveïdor de serveis de missatgeria instantània

descripGrp.descrip: Pertaining to a user who, during business hours (or at any time if no business hours have been set), is not signed in to any Lync or Communicator, or IM device and cannot be contacted by phone (no call forwarding information is published).

Pertaining to a user who, during business hours (or at any time if no business hours have been set), is not signed in to any Lync or Communicator, or IM device and cannot be contacted by phone (no call forwarding information is published).
A list that can be opened to reveal all choices for a given field.
To make resources, such as folders, printers, records, etc., unavailable to others.
A category of objects that share a common set of characteristics.
A quantity assigned to an element such as a variable, symbol, or label.
To store data in such a way that it can be retrieved later by the same security support component, and only by that security support component.

A table, query, form, report, macro, or module that remains in the replica or Design Master where it was created. Neither the object nor changes to the object are copied to other members in the replica set.
An option that applies a read-only state to a document inside client applications.
To associate a flag with a message or other item.
An item on the right-click menu for a contact that disconnects the selected participant from the current conversation.
Erroneous or unrecognizable because of a flaw in reasoning or an error in input. Invalid results, for example, might occur if the logic in a program is faulty.
A computational proof that Outlook applies to outgoing messages to help recipient messaging systems distinguish legitimate e-mail from junk e-mail.
A menu item in Internet Explorer that turns on the tool for Tablet PC users that allows the user to move the content of the page up and down, like a mouse scroll wheel.
To reverse changes.

A Web service that issues security tokens. A security token service makes assertions based on evidence that it trusts to whoever trusts it. To communicate trust, this service requires proof, such as a security token or set of security tokens, and it issues a security token with its own trust statement. (Note that for some security token formats, this can simply be a reissuance or cosignature.) In Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), the Federation Service is a security token service.

A Web service that issues security tokens. A security token service makes assertions based on evidence that it trusts to whoever trusts it. To communicate trust, this service requires proof, such as a security token or set of security tokens, and it issues a security token with its own trust statement. (Note that for some security token formats, this can simply be a reissuance or cosignature.) In Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS), the Federation Service is a security token service.
A directory that receives RFC-822 compliant files from the file system for the purpose of creating message objects that can be passed to the Submission queue.
The activities and actions performed by customer service representatives to assist customers.

In the Internet and other networks, the highest subdivision of a domain name in a network address, which identifies the type of entity owning the address (for example, .com for commercial users or .edu for educational institutions) or the geographical location of the address (for example, .fr for France or .sg for Singapore). The domain is the last part of the address (for example, www.acm.org).

In the Internet and other networks, the highest subdivision of a domain name in a network address, which identifies the type of entity owning the address (for example, .com for commercial users or .edu for educational institutions) or the geographical location of the address (for example, .fr for France or .sg for Singapore). The domain is the last part of the address (for example, www.acm.org).
A unit of work that is represented to users in the form of buttons, links, and menu items.
To move an item to a higher level within a tree structure.
The / character.
The 802.11b standard for wireless networking. A standard for delivering digital information over high-frequency, wireless local area networks.
The 802.11b standard for wireless networking. A standard for delivering digital information over high-frequency, wireless local area networks.

The server name, user name, password, and e-mail address used to connect to an e-mail service. You create the e-mail account using information provided by your mail administrator or Internet service provider (ISP).
A computer device that converts between circuit switch telephony protocols and VoIP protocols.
To create a user session for an Internet account. For example, you sign in to a Microsoft account, an Internet service provider account, or Skype.
A process by which antivirus and anti-spam agents and filters are applied to e-mail messages for the purpose of stopping unsolicited or malicious e-mails from entering the organization.
The display name of an attribute that specifies the position of an item in the list of contract line items.
A single media file, including art, sound, animation, or movies.
A single media file, including art, sound, animation, or movies.
A screen showing an active conference call.
To enroll in a service, often resulting in setting up a new account.
The UI element that opens a dialog box where the user can enter a new phone number for call forwarding.
To insert content, such as text or a graphic, that has been cut or copied from one document into a different location in the same or a different document.
The string that is received with a new call that is used to associate the call with a dial plan.
A program that creates files or makes changes to existing files.
A program that creates files or makes changes to existing files.
A system that sends and receives messages in the form of sound recordings.
To identify or designate with a label; describe or classify.
To make a duplicate copy of a program, a disk, or data.

Pertaining to keyboard settings, document views, user interface objects, and languages for which text is displayed in a left-to-right direction. English and most other European languages are left-to-right languages.
A control in Windows that enables the user to choose one option from a list of possibilities.
A movable piece on a device that is pressed to activate some function.
A movable piece on a device that is pressed to activate some function.
To notify by means of an alert that a particular event has occurred.
The aggregation, storage, analysis, and reporting of data for the purpose of informing business decision makers.
A view of a document as it will appear when you print it.
A table outside the open database or project.
The content that is delivered in an e-mail message.
A system job that publishes a duplicate detection rule.

termGrp.term: Publicació de la regla de detecció de duplicats

descripGrp.descrip: The digital signature functionality including Digital Signatures, electronic signatures, Mark As Final and Electronic Postmarks.

termGrp.term: Serveis de signatura per a l'Office

descripGrp.descrip: A DNS name that has been stated to indicate its absolute location in the domain namespace tree. In contrast to relative names, an FQDN has a trailing period (.) to qualify its position to the root of the namespace (host.example.contoso.com).
A UI command used to switch between accounts on a device.
An Active Directory object that contains information about an individual such as name, address, and job title. It can include a foreign e-mail address.
The overall plan or design of a document system.
In computer design, the arrangement of circuits and other components of the system.
Pertaining to characters that are formatted to appear darker and heavier than the surrounding text.
A menu that contains the most recently used items, such as documents, files or fonts.

The electronic components that generate the video signal sent through a cable to a video display. The video adapter is usually located on the computer's main system board or on an expansion board, but it is sometimes built into the terminal.

The electronic components that generate the video signal sent through a cable to a video display. The video adapter is usually located on the computer's main system board or on an expansion board, but it is sometimes built into the terminal.
An access control list that is controlled by the owner of an object and that specifies the access particular users or groups can have to the object.
An access control list that is controlled by the owner of an object and that specifies the access particular users or groups can have to the object.

Part of the integrated Routing and Remote Access service that provides remote networking for telecommuters, mobile workers, and system administrators who monitor and manage servers at multiple branch offices. Users can use Network Connections to dial in to remotely access their networks for services such as file and printer sharing, electronic mail, scheduling, and SQL database access.
A method of real-time communication over the Internet in which a sender types a message to one or more recipients and the recipient immediately receives the message in a chat area.
A method of real-time communication over the Internet in which a sender types a message to one or more recipients and the recipient immediately receives the message in a chat area.
A connection between the user's device and a server that provides access to the Internet, typically through an Internet service provider.
A connection between the user's device and a server that provides access to the Internet, typically through an Internet service provider.
In a PivotTable report, the summarized data calculated from the data fields of a source list or table.
The request by a user's browser for a Web page. The number of requests to view a page can indicate the frequency with which an ad is viewed.

A character used to control the format of displayed or printed information, rather than to represent a particular letter, digit, or other special character. The space ( ) is one of the more important nonprinting characters.
To scan a database, a list of files, or the Internet, either for a particular item or for anything that seems to be of interest.
Light that is beyond red in the color spectrum. While the light is not visible to the human eye, infrared transmitters and receivers can send and receive infrared signals.
A mailbox used by the E-mail Router to route incoming Microsoft Dynamics CRM e-mail messages and create activities for individual users.
A Control Panel feature that is used to set restrictions on what traffic is allowed to enter your network from the Internet.
A Web site that impersonates a trustworthy Web site to obtain user's personal or financial information.
The language used for the installation of software.
A utility that enables the user to locate and open files and folders.
A utility that enables the user to locate and open files and folders.
Any of the set of words that comprises a given programming language or set of operating-system routines.
The location where text or graphics will be inserted. Also used for text box controls to indicate input focus.

A feature that allows a Unified Messaging-enabled user to access their Microsoft Exchange Server mailbox over the telephone. Users can navigate through their mailboxes by using telephone-key or Speech input.
A status that can be applied to blocks of time in a user's Calendar to indicate that the user will be away.
The color against which characters and graphics are displayed.
Pertaining to items that occur repeatedly. For example, an appointment or task that occurs on a regular basis, such as a weekly status meeting or a monthly haircut, can be designated as recurring.
A file system used by MS-DOS and Microsoft Windows operating systems to organize and manage files.
A list that includes the e-mail addresses of mailing lists for which you want to be a recipient. Messages sent to such a mailing list and received by you will not be treated as junk e-mail.

A security feature that monitors programs on a computer to determine if they use system memory safely. To do this, DEP software works alone or with compatible microprocessors to mark some memory locations as "non-executable." If a program tries to run code that is malicious or is not from a protected location, DEP closes the program and notifies you.

A security feature that monitors programs on a computer to determine if they use system memory safely. To do this, DEP software works alone or with compatible microprocessors to mark some memory locations as "non-executable." If a program tries to run code that is malicious or is not from a protected location, DEP closes the program and notifies you.
A variable that contains a reference to an object.
A program you use to view, print, and electronically mail a snapshot, such as a report snapshot.

A mailbox folder (such as the Inbox folder) that appears in Office Outlook by default and to which messaging records management (MRM) has been applied. The retention and journaling of messages in managed default folders are controlled by managed content settings that are applied to the folder.

A designated server through which Exchange routes all outgoing messages. The smart host then makes the remote connection. If a smart host is designated, the Exchange server only needs to transmit to the smart host, instead of repeatedly contacting the domain until a connection is made.

A designated server through which Exchange routes all outgoing messages. The smart host then makes the remote connection. If a smart host is designated, the Exchange server only needs to transmit to the smart host, instead of repeatedly contacting the domain until a connection is made.
A company controlled by another company or corporation.

A feature that allows task work to be assigned to a group at the resource level to rather than to an individual. The total work load of the team resource includes both each individual's and the team's. These are not project teams.
The consistent positioning of text, graphics, and other objects.
The degree to which a product or service executes its specified function.

In Windows-based systems, a list of access control entries (ACE) that apply to an entire object, a set of the object's properties, or an individual property of an object, and that define the access granted to one or more security principals.

In Windows-based systems, a list of access control entries (ACE) that apply to an entire object, a set of the object's properties, or an individual property of an object, and that define the access granted to one or more security principals.
A clustered Exchange deployment that uses shared storage and can have multiple active and passive servers (referred to as nodes) dedicated to a clustered mailbox server.
Free or busy information for internal or federated contacts obtained by Lync or Office Communicator from Microsoft Outlook via a web service.

On a keyboard, the combination of a plastic keycap, a tension mechanism that suspends the keycap but allows it to be pressed down, and an electronic mechanism that records the key press and key release.
To move a call to another phone before the call is answered.
In respect to privacy, an individual's ability to view, modify, and contest the accuracy and completeness of PII collected about him or her. Access is an element of the Fair Information Practices.
An outlined container that displays a markup element, such as a comment or revision, in the margin of a document.
To activate an application program (especially on the Macintosh) from the operating system's user interface.
A Microsoft web-based service that provides customized accounts to users so that they can select, purchase, download, and update software applicable to Microsoft Windows from multiple retailers.
Header and footer information, or header information only, which encapsulates or precedes document data for transport.
A forum on the Internet for discussions on a specified range of subjects.
Technology that enables rendering operations to be handled by the client.
Technology that enables rendering operations to be handled by the client.
In a DVD or a video, a portion of a title, such as a scene or sequence. A title can contain one or more chapters.

A pane that displays document property information for Word, Excel, and PowerPoint files stored in a WSS library. The pane is displayed below the ribbon and is actually a hosted custom InfoPath form. Information is synced automatically between the document and the WSS library.
The smallest executable entity within a programming language.
A compact disc containing audio information (as opposed to a CD-ROM containing data and files).
A formal offer for products or services, proposed at specific prices and related payment terms.
A customer service issue or problem reported by a customer and the activities that customer service representatives use to resolve it.
A customer service issue or problem reported by a customer and the activities that customer service representatives use to resolve it.
A standard signaling protocol for establishing multi-media communications sessions between two or more users over an IP network.
A standard signaling protocol for establishing multi-media communications sessions between two or more users over an IP network.
A named storage area on a computer or device containing files and other folders. Folders are used to organize information electronically, the same way actual folders in a filing cabinet do.
A button that directs the user to the Home section of an application.
The act of splitting a single copy of a message to multiple copies of the message.
The text that forms the major content of a publication. Does not include titles, headlines, pull quotes, and captions, for example.
A data type that can only hold a whole number with a value greater than, or equal to, zero. In this implementation, the maximum value that an unsigned integer can hold is 0xFFFFFFFF (4,294,967,295).
Pertaining to applications or commands run in the order listed and that must finish before the next application or command is run.
To convert encrypted content back into its original form.
A key in a database table that comes from another table (also know as the "referenced table") and whose values match the primary key (PK) or unique key in the referenced table.
A key in a database table that comes from another table (also know as the "referenced table") and whose values match the primary key (PK) or unique key in the referenced table.
A key in a database table that comes from another table (also know as the "referenced table") and whose values match the primary key (PK) or unique key in the referenced table.
A predefined combination of grouped and sorted messages in table view.
A field which appears in the 'Company Information' section of the default 'Account' form.
A high definition optical disc format which uses a smaller focus blue-violet 405 nm laser allowing higher precision and storage density. A competitor to Blu-ray Disc.
A dialog box that displays information about an object in the interface.

A data structure that contains security information associated with a protected object. Security descriptors include information about who owns the object, who can access it and in what way, and what types of access are audited.
A shape that consists of a number of stars (e.g. ★★★). Used for data graphics solution to visualize the data.
To arrange to receive a product or use a service regularly.

A mailbox server that is installed in a Windows failover cluster. A clustered mailbox server is used in both cluster continuous replication (CCR) and single copy cluster (SCC) configurations. A clustered mailbox server was called an Exchange Virtual Server in previous versions of Exchange Server.

termGrp.term: servidor de bústies de correu en clúster

descripGrp.descrip: A set of components and services that enable voice, fax, and e-mail messages to be stored in a user's single mailbox. Users can also access their Microsoft Exchange Server 2007 mailbox from a telephone or a computer.

termGrp.term: Funció del servidor de missatgeria unificada

descripGrp.descrip: A UI element that sends an instant message to the selected person inviting them to join the current conversation.
A character that separates items in a list.
An audible or visual warning signal, generated by a computer, indicating that a threshold has been or is about to be breached.
A display option of the Windows Control Panel that makes it look and work like it did in previous versions.
A template that will walk you through key areas of evaluating a product's performance after it has been placed in the marketplace.

termGrp.term: Avaluació d'un producte després del seu llançament

descripGrp.descrip: In Windows-based systems, a unique value that identifies a user, group, or computer account within an enterprise. Every account is issued a SID when it is created.
In Windows-based systems, a unique value that identifies a user, group, or computer account within an enterprise. Every account is issued a SID when it is created.
In Windows-based systems, a unique value that identifies a user, group, or computer account within an enterprise. Every account is issued a SID when it is created.
A teleconferencing participant who can activate and deactivate a phone conference.
A file that stores information about a connection to a data source, such as an Access database, spreadsheet, or text file, and that facilitates data source administration.
A file that stores information about a connection to a data source, such as an Access database, spreadsheet, or text file, and that facilitates data source administration.

termGrp.term: fitxer de connexió de dades de l'Office

descripGrp.descrip: A camera for use with a computer to transmit a video picture.
To bring a form, service, server farm, or form template offline gradually by not accepting new user sessions and allowing existing sessions to finish.
An SQL-specific query that contains data definition language (DDL) statements. These statements allow you to create or alter objects in the database.
A feature that enables the user to create, manage and apply standardized citations and references in a document.
A feature that allows access to SharePoint documents and sites and documents on shares inside of a corporate network through Outlook Web Access when it is used remotely.
To find.
A digital interface specification for delivering digital content and connecting consumer electronic devices.

A person, inside or outside your organization, for whom you have created an entry where you can save several types of information, such as street and e-mail addresses, telephone and fax numbers, and Web page URLs.
The device that communicates between your software program and your printer.
The mechanism used to help a caller differentiate between users with names that match the touch-tone or speech input.

termGrp.term: Mètode de selecció basat en el nom

descripGrp.descrip: Antispyware software included in Windows that can prevent other software from displaying advertisements (such as pop-up ads), collect information about you, or change settings on your computer, generally without appropriately obtaining your consent.
Of, relating to, or organized as a hierarchy.
A button that opens the Change Font dialog box, where the user can select a new font, style, size, and effects for instant messages.
A tool that lets you enter complex characters and symbols, such as those used in East Asian written languages, using a standard keyboard.

A file or other store that describes the logical layout of a Web site (as distinct from the physical layout of pages). Site maps are used by site navigation controls to display navigation using a menu, tree view, or SiteMapPath (breadcrumb) control.
The description of the status of a record or activity. The options available are based on what record type is open and in which module.
Pertaining to keyboard settings, document views, user interface objects, languages, etc. for which text is displayed in a right-to-left direction.

A line printed above, below, or to the side of some element, either to set that item off from the remainder of the page or to improve the look of the page. Footnotes, for example, often appear below a short rule that sets them off from the main text on the page. The thickness of a rule is typically measured in points. (A point is approximately 1/72 inch.)
The information about a computer that's derived from the System Information program.
A set of items or devices working together to accomplish a task.
A networking standard that uses cables to provide network access. Ethernet is the most widely installed technology for connecting computers.

A character-encoding standard developed by the Unicode Consortium that represents almost all of the written languages of the world. The Unicode character repertoire has multiple representation forms, including UTF-8, UTF-16, and UTF-32. Most Windows interfaces use the UTF-16 form.

A type of display that uses a liquid compound having a polar molecular structure, sandwiched between two transparent electrodes. When an electric field is applied, the molecules align with the field, forming a crystalline arrangement that polarizes the light passing through it. A polarized filter laminated over the electrodes blocks polarized light. In this way, a grid of electrodes can selectively "turn on" a cell, or a pixel, containing the liquid crystal material, turning it dark.
Pertaining to a contact who is external to the user's organization or enterprise but with whom the user's organization or enterprise is linked.
The item on the user's My Status menu that the user can select while signed in to make it appear to other users that he or she is currently offline.
A source document that documents a payment request from another party.
A location in a program at which execution is halted so that a programmer can examine the program's status, the contents of variables, and so on.
A unique bank registration number that a bank uses to identify itself.
A unique bank registration number that a bank uses to identify itself.
The documents that are created with specific information about products and/or services and given to customers to help increase sales.

A type of property that allows authors to specify the values of several properties with a single property. For instance, the 'font' property is a shorthand property for setting 'font-style', 'font-variant', 'font-weight', 'font-size', 'line-height', and 'font-family' all at once.
A field label for the identifier of a conference that is conducted through a conferencing service provider.
A keyboard key that sends the escape (ESC) character to the computer. Often this key moves the user back one level in the menu structure or exits the program.
A logical relationship established between domains to allow pass-through authentication, in which a trusting domain honors the logon authentications of a trusted domain.
An identification number that is issued by a tax authority to indicate that a company is not required to pay sales tax.
A call-forwarding option that allows the user to set the number of seconds that the phone will ring before a call is redirected.
A feature that identifies people using computers near you so that you can use features and programs that use peer-to-peer technology.

A file containing information that the user either requires or will find informative and that might not have been included in the documentation. Readme files are placed on disk in plain-text form (without extraneous or program-specific characters) so that they can be read easily be a variety of word processing programs.

A file containing information that the user either requires or will find informative and that might not have been included in the documentation. Readme files are placed on disk in plain-text form (without extraneous or program-specific characters) so that they can be read easily be a variety of word processing programs.
A type of installation that allows the user to specify certain installation settings and options, such as which components will be installed.
The amount of light that is emitted by a computer monitor or picture displayed on the monitor.
An application that is used to open an attachment for Attachment Previewing.

In an environment capable of displaying multiple on-screen windows, any window other than the one currently being used for work. An inactive window can be partially or entirely hidden behind another window, and it remains inactive until the user selects it.
Pertaining to a user for whom no information is known. The user might not even exist, or there could be a typo in the SIP address.
A trust relationship between two or more SIP domains that permits users in separate organizations to communicate in real time across network boundaries.

An attempt to run a memory operation that the underlying page protection does not allow. An access violation applies to memory operations, but does not apply when the security manager checks user-mode access rights to objects.
An item on the right-click menu for the Communicator icon that appears in the Windows taskbar that signs the user out of Communicator and closes all open Communicator windows and dialog boxes.
A tool you use to create an expression. The Expression Builder includes a list of common expressions that you can select from to define the properties you want to target.

To duplicate information and reproduce it in another part of a document, in a different file or memory location, or in a different medium. A copy operation can affect data ranging from a single character to large segments of text, a graphics image, or from one to many data files.
A directory that you can use to store names, e-mail addresses, fax numbers, and distribution lists.
A directory that you can use to store names, e-mail addresses, fax numbers, and distribution lists.
Equipment, telephone or computer, used to place a call.
The authentication protocol (such as CHAP, PAP, EAP etc.) used when authenticating access to resources on a network.
A card-like layout on an Outlook Contact that provides the user with the look of a real world business card.
A card-like layout on an Outlook Contact that provides the user with the look of a real world business card.

A marketing program designed to accomplish a specific result, such as introducing a new product or increasing market share. The main way to accomplish this result is through communicating the benefits of a product or service to people and businesses. Campaigns often include more than one communication method, such as print advertisements, promotional discounts, and direct mail.

A marketing program designed to accomplish a specific result, such as introducing a new product or increasing market share. The main way to accomplish this result is through communicating the benefits of a product or service to people and businesses. Campaigns often include more than one communication method, such as print advertisements, promotional discounts, and direct mail.
The pairing of two or more actions that are performed together as a single action; the action succeeds or fails as a whole.
To temporarily suspend an active phone call.
An access code that is needed in order for a user to join a conference as a leader. This string is entered in the Options dialog box, on the Accounts tab, under Conferencing Information.
To displace the left or right edge of a text item, such as a block or a line, relative to the margin or to another text item.
Microsoft's portal Web site for Small Business.
An individual training session on a subject.
The text string that appears in place of an image when a Web page is loading, when graphics are not being displayed, or when users pause on the image itself with their mouse.
A feature that enables the user to access Outlook data over the Internet without a VPN connection.
Software that is used to compress or decompress a digital media file.
A feature that allows users to allocate resources or document resource requirements, in the absence of a detailed project plan containing resource assignments.
A form that can be opened and filled in on a mobile device, like a PDA or smartphone.

termGrp.term: Web-enabled InfoPath form for mobile devices
Formulari de l'InfoPath habilitat per al web per a dispositius mòbils

descripGrp.descrip: Someone granted permission to access items or perform functions on another user's behalf.

The name of a pane at the bottom of the Calendar module where tasks are displayed. Tasks that are completed on a particular day "stick" to the day and are shown as a record of what work was performed on that day. Tasks not completed roll over to the next day and accumulate until completed.
An item on the user's My Status menu that resets the user's status to the previous setting after the user has manually selected a status setting.
A status that indicates that an active telephone call has been temporarily suspended.
A note alongside the main text that contains interesting or useful information.
A feature that may be able to identify the root cause of crashes if an Office application is repeatedly crashing.
The blank space outside the printing area on a page.
The blank space outside the printing area on a page.
A set of techniques that you can use to make your Microsoft Silverlight-based applications more accessible.
To make a form, view, device or other resource available over a network.

Information displayed to a user about someone else adding him or her to a contact list, a contact's offline or online status, a missed conversation, voice mail message, service problem, or other item.
A miniature version of an image that is often used for quick browsing through multiple images.
The top level of a business hierarchy.
A data type that is automatically updated every time a row is inserted or updated.
An independent section on a webpage. Each frame is actually a separate webpage and can have its own scrollbars.

An application that consolidates a user's voice mail, fax, and e-mail into one mailbox, so that the user only needs to check a single location for messages, regardless of type. The e-mail server is used as the platform for all types of messages, making it unnecessary to maintain separate voice mail and e-mail infrastructures.

An application that consolidates a user's voice mail, fax, and e-mail into one mailbox, so that the user only needs to check a single location for messages, regardless of type. The e-mail server is used as the platform for all types of messages, making it unnecessary to maintain separate voice mail and e-mail infrastructures.
A software error that occurs while a program is being executed, as detected by a compiler or other supervisory program.
The most recent price of a product or service.
Tasks that a user is permitted to perform on a computer system or domain.
A series of instructions that is repeated a fixed number of times or until a terminating condition is reached.

A piece of handheld equipment such as a portable music or video player, PDA (personal digital assistant), mobile phone, or Windows Mobile device that works on its own but can also connect to a computer. Many of these devices can sync information with Windows.
The process of temporarily storing recently accessed information in a special memory subsystem for quicker access.

In general, a modular unit of code that acts as part of a larger system or structure. For COM, a unit of code built to deliver a well-specified set of services through well-specified interfaces. A component provides an object that a client requests at runtime.

User's perception about the utility usability and desirability of a product as they integrate it into their lives and their family system. The user experience will be the differentiator that drives adoption and use of hardware software and services.
A drop-down list from which users can select the method of distribution (for a campaign activity), or the method of how a customer's case will be handled (for an entitlement).
A drop-down list from which users can select the method of distribution (for a campaign activity), or the method of how a customer's case will be handled (for an entitlement).

Information that includes identification and proof of identification that is used to gain access to local and network resources. Examples of credentials are user names and passwords, smart cards, and certificates.

Information that includes identification and proof of identification that is used to gain access to local and network resources. Examples of credentials are user names and passwords, smart cards, and certificates.

Information that includes identification and proof of identification that is used to gain access to local and network resources. Examples of credentials are user names and passwords, smart cards, and certificates.
A technology that is based on the Component Object Model (COM) that enables interoperability among ActiveX components, including OLE components. Formerly referred to as OLE Automation.
A feature that consists of advanced text wrap functionality, allowing the user to select from various styles to specify how text flows around objects or graphics in a document.
A 32-bit integer that identifies a property set.
A mode that enables the user to move a document by dragging it. Panning mode is available when a Word document is displayed on a preview pane.
The field name for the confirmation status used to categorize how firmly a service activity has been scheduled. The options include Requested, Tending, Pending, Reserved, In Progress, and Arrived.
Pertaining to a message sent in real time through a network to a private chat area.
Pertaining to a message sent in real time through a network to a private chat area.
A calendaring feature that automatically manages resources. Resource requests are automatically accepted or denied depending on availability and policies.

An enhanced spell-check feature that looks at words before or after the word in question to assess proper usage. This allows the software to flag correctly-spelled words as 'wrong' if the usage appears to be incorrect.
A schedulable appointment to provide a service to a customer. A service activity uses one or more resources to perform a service at a specific time and place.
A set of extensions to the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) that facilitates collaborative editing and file management between users located remotely from each other on the Internet.
A set of extensions to the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) that facilitates collaborative editing and file management between users located remotely from each other on the Internet.
