A continuous sequence of characters that share a common format.
A function or object that invokes an event handler when a specific condition occurs in an application.

A certificate extension that contains information useful for verifying the trust status of a certificate, as defined by the 2008 Memo of the Network Working Group. This information potentially includes Uniform Resource Locations (URLs) where the issuing CA’s certificate can be retrieved, as well as a location of an Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) responder configured to provide status for the certificate in question.

descripGrp.descrip: A certificate extension that indicates where the certificate revocation list for a CA can be retrieved. It can contain none, one, or many HTTP, file, or LDAP URLs.
In a public key infrastructure hierarchy, the certification authority that that issues certificates to users and computers.
In a public key infrastructure hierarchy, the certification authority that that issues certificates to users and computers.

A protocol that allows real-time validation of a certificate’s status by having the CryptoAPI make a call to an OCSP responder and the OCSP responder providing an immediate validation of the revocation status for the presented certificate. Typically, an OCSP responder responds with the revocation status check request based on the certificate revocation list (CRL) or other forms of revocation status it retrieves from the certification authorities.

A protocol that allows real-time validation of a certificate’s status by having the CryptoAPI make a call to an OCSP responder and the OCSP responder providing an immediate validation of the revocation status for the presented certificate. Typically, an OCSP responder responds with the revocation status check request based on the certificate revocation list (CRL) or other forms of revocation status it retrieves from the certification authorities.

termGrp.term: Protocol d'estat de certificat en línia

descripGrp.descrip: A configuration mode for the Certificate Enrollment Web Service in which it will only process renewal requests.
A hexadecimal string that contains the SHA-1 hash of the certificate.

In Server Manager and Event Viewer, the urgency of an event or error condition, system fault, failure, or action by either the system or the user. Severity can be any of four industry-standard values: Information, Warning, Error, or Critical. These values are defined in the Event Viewer Help.
A process that builds one or more certificate paths. The certificate paths may or may not trace up to a self-signed or root certificate.

A certificate extension used by the certificate chaining engine to determine what certificate was used to sign a presented certificate. The AKI can contain the issuer name, serial number, public key information, or no information at all. By matching the information in a certificate’s AKI extension to a CA certificate’s Subject Key Identifier (SKI) extension, a certificate chain can be built.

termGrp.term: Identificador de la clau de l'autoritat

descripGrp.descrip: A certificate extension used by the certificate chaining engine to determine what certificate was used to sign a presented certificate. By matching the information in a certificate’s AKI extension to a CA certificate’s Subject Key Identifier (SKI) extension, a certificate chain can be built.

A class, interface, or structure whose definition has placeholders, called generic type parameters, for one or more types that are used in its member definitions. A user specifies real types (generic type arguments) for the type parameters when creating an instance of a generic type.

In Windows Presentation Foundation and Silverlight, a technique by which a subset of UI elements are generated from a larger number of data items based on which items are visible on the screen. Virtualization is a performance enhancement, because it is intensive, both in terms of memory and processor, to generate a large number of UI elements when only a few may be on the screen at a given time.

The sound alerts, alerts on screen (text), and badges that are pushed by applications to a device. For the Windows Phone, push notifications are available through the Lync Server Push Notification Service. For the iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch devices, notifications are available through the Apple Push Notification Service.
The label for a check-box that when selected establishes automatic detection of the server upon signing in.

​A cloud communications service that connects people. Lync Online provides intuitive communications capabilities across presence, instant messaging, audio/video calling, and an online meeting experience that includes audio, video, and web conferencing.

A multitasking feature that allows for running code periodically in the background.

A control that provides a quick way to manage the navigation of views within an application.
When an app on Windows Phone is deactivated, a record that is kept by the operating system about which screen the user was on.
A message generated by Microsoft Dynamics CRM when an event occurs, or a message created by a CRM user.
Part of a post that refers to a Microsoft Dynamics CRM record.
To track content, people or other entities by adding them to a list of things that you care about and for which you would like to surface updates about changes and activities.
Action taken by a Microsoft Dynamics CRM user on a CRM record (such as an Account – Contoso) that stops posts about that CRM record from showing up on the user’s personal Wall.

All published reactions (such as comments, likes, and retweets) to a single post.

A statement that a device makes to indicate that it can be trusted to access secure resources, such a folder on a file share.

The program that enables developers to connect to Live and easily use Microsoft account, OneDrive, Hotmail, and Messenger within their apps, websites, and devices. Live Connect provides a set of standards-based APIs and the downloadable Live SDK.
A nonfinal release of Windows that's made available to developers.

A statement indicating that the copyright holder reserves, or holds for their own use, all the rights provided by copyright law, such as distribution, performance, and creation of derivative works; that is, they have not waived any such right.

A small amount of executable code contained in the master boot record that scans the partition table for the active partition, finds the starting sector of the active partition, loads a copy of the boot sector from the active partition into memory, and transfers control to the executable code in the boot sector.

The Unicode character U+1F007, which represents a Mahjong tile.
The Unicode character U+1D301, which represents a Tai Xuan Jing symbol.
The Unicode character U+1D30F, which represents a Tai Xuan Jing symbol.
A Unicode character with hex value U+1F110
The download package that includes People, Messaging, Mail, and Calendar.
A secondary encryption key that provides the ability for an authorized IT Helpdesk administrator to open an encrypted document when the password is lost.
A canary whose value changes depending on the request context.
A feature of Internet Explorer 10 that allows users to easily switch between websites and their corresponding apps.
A collection of keys or key and value pairs that is used for content or query processing in search.
The process of detecting the file type of an item during content processing, and converting the item to text.
The process of extracting information from unstructured text in an item and storing that information as additional managed properties for the item.
A content processing or query processing pipeline that contains operators that determine how the content or the query is processed.
A copy of a search index within an index partition.
An object that processes and enhances items in a content processing flow and processes and enhances queries in a query processing flow.
An XML document that describes how to rank items in search results.
A process that ensures that index replicas on the same index partition remain syncronized during regular operation and during recovery.
A collection of managed properties that are updated together in the search index.
A managed property that can be queried against. The query must contain the managed property field name, either in the query itself or programmatically.
A managed property that can be used as the basis for a refiner for search results.

termGrp.term: propietat administrada per a restricció de cerques

descripGrp.descrip: A managed property that can be displayed in search results.
A managed property whose value can be returned by a query.
A managed property whose result set can be sorted based on the property before the result set is returned.

A user defined dictionary that lists single words or phrases that the system matches to words in the content in either a case-sensitive way or a case-insensitive way, depending on the type of dictionary that is used.

A custom extraction dictionary that lists words or phrases that are matched to exact words in the content in a case-sensitive way. For example, the system matches "anchor" to "anchor," but not to "Anchor" or "Anchorage."

A custom extraction dictionary that lists words or phrases that are matched anywhere in the content in a case-sensitive way. For example, the system matches "anchor" and "anchorage," but not "Anchor."

termGrp.term: diccionari d'extracció de parts exactes de paraules

descripGrp.descrip: A custom extraction dictionary that lists words or phrases that are matched to exact words in the content in a case-insensitive way. For example, the entry "anchor" will match "anchor" and "Anchor," but not "anchorage."

A custom extraction dictionary that lists words or phrases that are matched anywhere in the content in a case-insensitive way. For example, the entry "anchor" will match "anchor," "Anchor," and "anchorage."

termGrp.term: diccionari d'extracció de parts de paraules

descripGrp.descrip: A data structure that describes crawled properties, managed properties, and the mapping between them.
A logical portion of the search index.
A set of apps that includes Messenger, Photo Gallery, Movie Maker, OneDrive, Mail, Writer, and Family Safety. (Family Safety is only included in Windows 7 downloads; it's built in to Windows 8.)

A tool in Office 365 that enables IT professionals to manage how Office is installed for their users. Users receive the correct language and configurations individually tailored to them automatically, without the need to install anything themselves.
A mode in which SharePoint Server is the primary source for all the project details. Project Server scheduling, time and status, and advanced functionality are disabled.

A Windows feature that enables users to connect computers with a simple tap gesture or by browsing for computers within wireless range. If two computers come within 3-4 centimeters of each other, or are tapped together, the operating system of each computer becomes aware of the other computer. Also, a user can browse for computers within wireless range that are advertising for a peer connection. The user can then connect the two computers to share content such as photos or links, or create a multi-player experience. If the connection is made using a tap gesture, the user can also publish and subscribe to messages transmitted during the tap.
A feature of Windows where a user's credentials are securely stored.
To take action on an email message by either replying to the sender, to the sender and all recipients, or by forwarding the email to someone else.
A pane in the Outlook window that contains folders for each view, such as Mail or Calendar.
A feature of Windows that provide right-click access from taskbar program buttons to the documents, pictures, songs, or websites a user frequently accesses.
A feature of Windows that provide right-click access from taskbar program buttons to the documents, pictures, songs, or websites a user frequently accesses.
A nonfinal release of Internet Explorer 10.
A short video sent as an email message to someone in the contact list.
A short video sent as an email message to someone in the contact list.
A technique that increases sharpness and fidelity by compensating for some effects that camera movement has on images in videos.
A technique that increases sharpness and fidelity by compensating for some effects that camera movement has on images in videos.

The cloud service that enables users to communicate and collaborate with people online and access their conversations, photos, documents, contacts, appointments, settings, and services across PC, phone, and other devices.
A user action that is counted and analyzed by the recommendations algorithm in the Analytics Service.
A metadata navigation control that enables users to limit the items displayed in a list or library to those that match selected values.

A feature that allows for preservation of content documents, pages, and messages in Exchange and SharePoint so that when they are modified or deleted, the original version can still be accessed for electronic discovery and other legal purposes.
The screen that appears when a user locks the PC.
A tool that allows users to upload email messages, email folders, and contacts from an email account on their PC to the cloud to facilitate access from multiple devices.
An image stabilization technique used to remove wobbled distortions from a video captured with a rolling shutter camera that's exposed to large accelerations or jitter.
An image stabilization technique that's used to reduce the appearance of camera shake in a video image.
An image stabilization technique that's used to reduce the appearance of camera shake in a video image.

A Microsoft Office product that identifies business-critical Excel spreadsheets and Access databases by discovering files across network shares and SharePoint libraries, and that provides flexible risk assessment and categorization based on relevance, materiality and business impact.
A Microsoft Office product that provides interactive diagnostics to identify errors, deviations from spreadsheet best practices and insights into data flow in and out of the spreadsheet.
A Microsoft Office product that detects and categorizes changes between two spreadsheets to facilitate review and approval processes.
A Microsoft Office product that detects and categorizes changes between two databases to facilitate review and approval processes.

A Microsoft Office product that provides non-intrusive auditing of changes made to Excel spreadsheets and Access databases, and supports alerts, notifications and automatic workflows based on user activities such as macro or formula changes.
Denotes the experience with Lync that can be scheduled, or ad-hoc. A Lync Meeting provides the ability to interact with people through video, audio, instant messaging, and content sharing.
Alerts to Lync users about the quality of the network, computer, camera, and lighting conditions.

The feature that lets users create and share OneNote meeting notes in a Lync Meeting. Notes appear as docked in a Lync Meeting, with participant lists that can be updated in meeting notes for participants to see.
A call that connects Lync users with peer-to-peer capabilities. Users can start a video call by pointing to a contact in the Contacts view and then clicking the video call icon.
A video preview for a Lync user that provides options to answer with video from within the notification.
The web browser component of Windows that provides a traditional and familiar browsing experience.
The touch-optimized, immersive web browser for Windows.
A collection of Lync Meeting host and presenter controls that optimizes for the type of meeting, size of audience, content, and/or video sources available to participants.
Denotes the Conversation window that handles escalations (peer-to-peer to conference) and scalable views that display people and content together inside a Lync Meeting.

A type of chat in which messages are posted to a chat room where they can be viewed and responded to in real time by multiple participants. Users can search for other rooms by name, member/owner, keywords, and content across groups from Lync.
A menu bar that appears beside the picture area of a contact in the Lync Contacts list that shows the available communication modes: IM, Call, Video, and View card.
Gives Lync system administrators the ability to monitor pools, servers, and networks across data centers through the public Internet.
Provides the ability to have softphone-based audio, video, and meetings (peer-to-peer and multiparty) without the problems of latency, jitter, and packet loss.

descripGrp.descrip: Provide Lync Online administrators with the ability to run Lync Online PowerShell cmdlets and assign role-based access control (RBAC) roles to other administrators in the organization.

A video compression standard that encodes high-quality video bitstreams. Support for the capability enables the conferencing server to determine how bitstreams should flow among receiving clients, based on the capabilities and bandwidth of the receiving endpoint.
Restricts the client versions that are used in a Lync Server environment.
A set of Front End Servers, configured identically, that work together to provide services for a common group of users.
A number assigned to a parked call by the Call Park application.
A document service that enables organizations to provision and manage online storage for their users.
A document service that enables organizations to provision and manage online storage for their users.
A feature that validates, signs, and stores boot information in the Trusted Platform Module chip to verify the integrity of the PC.
A feature whereby the A/V Conferencing Server calls the user, and the user answers the phone to join the conference.
A method of real-time communication wherein participants share and collaborate on several data and document types. The session can be hosted on an in-house server, an Internet-based service, or both.
A section in the default OneNote notebook where certain notes are stored by default.
A tab available to users who are signed in on Office.com where they can launch Office on Demand and access their most recently used online documents and folders.
A feature that allows the user to choose an external data provider, and update the records in the CRM system based on the information from that data provider.

A feature of the Bing Finance app that lets users choose stocks to watch and personalize the app with these choices.

An app for Office that is embedded in the body of a client application window, inline with content.

descripGrp.descrip: An app for Office that resides within a task pane in a client application.

A button that shuts down or restarts the PC.
The option that lets users choose, be default, what mode they will view records in forms in.
Type of form that is not editable, so viewers can quickly see data, but not modify it.

A collection of Office.com content about the people and tools that make work and life easier for people living with disability.
An assignment property that indicates whether grades for the assignment are numeric or non-numeric.
To remotely view, stream, or copy files stored on a PC running OneDrive from any other device.
A part of the Activity Feeds solution, where the posts about records are displayed.

descripGrp.descrip: An account on a social networking site such as Facebook or Twitter that you connect to from Microsoft Dynamics CRM.
A business entity, typically a company, that provides up to date data to a Microsoft Dynamics CRM user.
A business entity, typically a company, that provides up to date data to a Microsoft Dynamics CRM user.
The record that contains person-specific information (age, height, etc) in CRM.

In the Business Network feature in CRM, the connection that a person has to another person, whether explicit, where the relationship is defined, or implicit, where the people may have had contact, but the relationship is not defined.
An entity that represents a person, declared as such in metadata.
An entity that represents a person in the Business Network, to which person-type entities in CRM can be linked.
An explicit (for example, “colleague”) or implicit (for example, “sent 100 emails in the last 30 days”) relationship, with inherent strength, between people in the Business Network.

A role that is similar to the customer service role, with the addition of being able to manage public conversations enabled and with the following permissions: organization read, BU append, BU append to, and user delete.
In a pie chart that represents records, for example, cases broken out by source, the part of the "pie" (the slice) that represents social sources such as Facebook, Twitter, and other social channels.

An action by which a subscription (the source subscription) is replaced by a new subscription, both owned by the same billing account, along a preconfigured conversion path. The source subscription is canceled and the destination subscription is the new subscription.
A new subscription that is created as a result of a conversion or a merge.
To add to or augment data that is in the system, usually from an outside data service provider.
A subscription that is canceled to create a new subscription as a result of a conversion or merge.
A partner in scenarios where the partner providing the offer is different than the partner providing the service, for example, Xbox selling Messenger products.
Replace a set of subscriptions with a new subscription.
The process of activating tokens during a purchase.
The process of activating tokens during a purchase.
A subscription that can only be paid with a prepaid card.
A company that provides reporting compliance services.
A company that provides reporting compliance services.
A type of process that displays the input forms and the data that a user needs at each step while interacting with a customer or following a process that requires user input.
A set of logical rules that define the steps necessary to automate specific business processes, tasks, or sets of actions to be performed on Microsoft Dynamics CRM records.
Functionality supplied by the Web Conferencing service such as data sharing, and uploading documents and PowerPoint presentations, by using whiteboards and desktop sharing.
A component that sits inside the CRM deployment and delivers messages received at an endpoint to the target organization.

Oient del Microsoft Dynamics CRM per al Microsoft Azure

Like Survivable Branch Appliances, this device can provide voice mail survivability for branch users during a WAN outage.

termGrp.term: Servidor de branca amb funcions de supervivència

descripGrp.descrip: A wall in Dynamics CRM for conversations that are marked as being able to be seen by the entire organization.
Creating relationships between an email activity and other records by using the information from email headers.
Keeping a record of chat conversations in CRM, which occur through Lync.
A feature in Microsoft Dynamics CRM that allows users to connect to the email service of their choice from CRM.
To remove the mapping from a folder to OneDrive.
A workflow step whose actions can read from and write to all items in a site.
A feature that synchronizes SAP roles and SharePoint user profiles, which enables administrators to secure SharePoint objects such as sites, lists and items using SAP roles.
The process that populates data to the Office Telemetry Log.
A stylistic variation on a font that provides an alternative to its default appearance.

The operating system designed for enthusiasts and business/technical pros that includes all of the features in Windows 8, plus features for encryption, virtualization, PC management, and domain connectivity.

The operating system for PCs and tablets powered by x86 (32-bit) and AMD (64-bit) processors that includes an updated Windows Explorer, Task Manager, better multi-monitor support, and fast language switching.

The operating system only available pre-installed on PCs and tablets powered by ARM processors that helps enable new thin and lightweight form factors with impressive battery life. Windows RT includes touch-optimized versions of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and OneNote.
A downloadable pack that adds features to Windows 8 or Windows 8 Single Language editions to move them to a Windows 8 Pro edition with Windows Media Center installed.
An edition of Windows 8 that is available only through volume licensing.
An edition of Windows 8 designed to make Windows affordable to mainstream consumers in emerging markets.
A media pack add-on to Windows 8 Pro that upgrades the edition to include Windows Media Center.
The button or slider on tablets and convertible tablets that rotates the display.
An Exchange mailbox that is associated with a SharePoint site, enabling users to access documents and email related to group projects through either Outlook or SharePoint.
An edition of Windows 8 Pro that contains Windows Media Center.

termGrp.term: Windows 8 Pro amb el Media Center

descripGrp.descrip: A feature in the PowerPivot add-in for Excel that identifies the categories of data in your Excel workbook (such as cities, sports teams, or animals), sends those data categories online to Microsoft, and recommends other sets of similar data that might interest you.

termGrp.term: Microsoft Data Categorization and Recommendation Service
Servei de categorització i recomanació de dades de Microsoft

descripGrp.descrip: A feature in the PowerPivot add-in for Excel that identifies the categories of data in your Excel workbook (such as cities, sports teams, or animals), sends those data categories online to Microsoft, and recommends other sets of similar data that might interest you.
Authenticated access that can be granted to external partners and clients to enable sharing of selected SharePoint Online content.
A unique link that provides external users anonymous access to selected documents stored in SharePoint Online, with no sign in required.
A feature that enables rich visualizations for interactive data exploration, presentation and reporting in SharePoint and Excel.
The release candidate release of the Windows 8 operating system.

An automated proactive scan that triggers when NTFS detects a corruption. The scan is equivalent to the scan phase of chkdsk and finds and logs all corruptions to an internal file. This scan runs during maintenance hours, can be triggered from the Explorer, or manually run from a command line. When this scan is running in the background, some NTFS operations may be blocked.

A registry setting that allows the DHCP client to transmit more messages to the server to obtain an IP address when the PC is in connected standby mode. This setting can increase power consumption but can also help resolve IP address (IPv4 or IPv6) problems more quickly.

A service within Remote Desktop Services responsible for aggregating RemoteApp programs and desktops that are published to end users from across the entire deployment. It ensure only users with appropriate rights can access published resources. The resources are used to display error messages that, for example, might say that the publishing service is unavailable. This can help the admin debug their deployment.
The capability to sign in to a PC by using a four-digit code.
A software setting that disables display rotation.
Collectively, the SharePoint service applications that write to ULS logs using shared code for automated document processing.
An instrumentation and logging platform that provides monitoring, reporting and log viewing capabilities for Office servers and services.
An instrumentation and logging platform that provides monitoring, reporting and log viewing capabilities for Office servers and services.

An application-hosting architecture that relies on cloud-based services. Application logic and data are typically hosted on a distributed set of services on the Internet, connected through web APIs, and authenticated with server-to-server authentication technologies such as OAuth.
A menu item that lets the user open a document using a different application than the one associated with the document type.

Data that shows how partner products are used including where, how often, with which other software and hardware. This helps them identify user needs and experiences as well as potential marketing and product improvement opportunities over time. Partners and Microsoft can better understand what happens between planning, lab testing, sales data, and real world scenarios over time.

Data that shows how partner products are used including where, how often, with which other software and hardware. This helps them identify user needs and experiences as well as potential marketing and product improvement opportunities over time. Partners and Microsoft can better understand what happens between planning, lab testing, sales data, and real world scenarios over time.
A function that returns the first non-null expression from a list of arguments.

An optional feature of Lync Online that enables users to make calls to, and receive calls from, the traditional network by using Lync. This feature is available to Voice Plan customers only, and administrators must sign in with a Lync-to-phone provider to get the feature.

An app for Mac computers that creates a folder on the user's computer, downloads the contents of their OneDrive, and keeps the folder in sync with any file changes online and among additional computers.
A feature that facilitates the use of Presenter View by automatically applying the Extend setting for Windows projection and identifying the correct display for Slide Show versus Presenter view.
A feature in Presenter View that enables the user to switch which monitor is showing Presenter View and which monitor is showing Slide Show.
A web-based management portal for Lync Online services.
A nonfinal release of Internet Explorer 10 that follows the consumer preview.
A component of an app for SharePoint that can be embedded on a site page to expose the functionality of the app.
An app that runs in a non-desktop app model, and runs on Windows, but is not necessarily sold or deployed via the Store.

termGrp.term: aplicació de la Botiga del Windows

descripGrp.descrip: A dropdown menu item or ribbon component that is added to a site page.
A type of custom action that is added to a host site by an app for SharePoint and that links to more functionality that is contained by the app.
An installation component of Lync Server used to display, adjust, and validate a planned topology.
Feeds that provide information and notifications based on the persistent chat room that you are following.
Part of the existing Lync Web App IIS web component. Lets users optionally join meetings by using a mobile device.
A method of image acquisition in which each frame is recorded by vertically or horizontally scanning the frame.
A rule that converts phone numbers to the local dialing format for interaction with private branch exchange (PBX) systems.
Microsoft Lync 2010 Attendee is a conferencing client that lets people who don't have Lync 2010 installed, participate in online meetings.

A route that contains instructions that tell Lync Server how to route calls from Enterprise Voice users to phone numbers on the public switched telephone network (PSTN), or a private branch exchange (PBX).

Define the following for each user, site, or organization that is assigned the policy: A set of calling features that can be enabled or disabled to determine the Enterprise Voice functionality that is available to users. Also, a set of PSTN usage records that define what types of calls are authorized.
A set of client version rules that defines the actions to be taken when users try to log on with specific clients and client versions.
A call that bypasses the Mediation Server.
The UI label for the button on the app bar that affixes a tile to the Start screen.
A utility that launches the appropriate Office application when a user tries to open an XML file.
A message in a persistent chat room that exceeds the character limit. If the character limit is exceeded, the message will show as "long message."

The network hubs or backbones that are used in the configuration of call admission control, E9-1-1, and media bypass. They interconnect parts of a network across multiple geographic areas, and every network region must be associated with a central site.

A network node originally defined in the National Emergency Number Association i2 network architecture that addresses the intermediate solution for providing Enhanced 9-1-1 (E9-1-1) service for VoIP telephony users.
Provides presence information and helps to manage preferences.
A collections of subnets with similar bandwidth, for example, a branch office location, a set of buildings, or a campus.
Defines bandwidth limitations between sites that are directly linked within a call admission control (CAC) configuration.
A status on a Lync contact card that indicates a camera is enabled.
Enables internal users to share audio and video data with external users (that is, users who are not logged on to your internal network).
A Lync Server service that is used to help maintain presence information for users and to manage meetings and conferences.
A website that provides tools and resources to help developers create apps for Office and SharePoint.

termGrp.term: Apps for Office and SharePoint Developer Center
Centre per a desenvolupadors d'aplicacions per a l'Office i el SharePoint

descripGrp.descrip: A Business Connectivity Services feature that enables developers to extend functionality that is provided by the OData connector.
The automatic display of photos in Windows Photos in a grid-like pattern based on metadata from the photos that are connected to the user's account.
A function relevant to an app in use that is displayed on the app bar.
The charm that takes users to the Start screen.
The functionality that allows users to switch back to recently used apps.
The state that enables a PC to turn on instantly and have tiles and other services update even when the screen is off.
A collection of Windows and device settings that users can change grouped into one location.
A tablet hardware button with the Windows logo on it that's similar to the Windows key on a keyboard. Pressing the Power and Windows buttons simultaneously is the equivalent of pressing Ctrl+Alt+Del.
The spreading of malicious content through online advertising.
The spreading of malicious content through online advertising.
A rating of how safe an app is determined to be by SmartScreen, according to age, presence of digital certificate, and other criteria.
An application that determines what the out-of-box experience will be.
An application that determines what the out-of-box experience will be.
A method exposed in a client object model to issue requests from SharePoint to a remote service that developers can use in apps for SharePoint.
A JavaScript library available in apps for SharePoint to allow cross-domain client-level communication.
An HTML and JavaScript based control that renders the top chrome, which is available to use in apps for SharePoint.
A 3D geospatial and temporal visualization tool that enables users to map, explore, and interact with information across multiple dimensions, allowing them to draw new insights from large data sets.

The Japanese kana characters that indicate the correct pronunciation, sorting, and grouping behavior of a word written in kanji. The name of a field that stores such characters and can impact the sorting/grouping behavior of a corresponding field that can contain a word written in kanji. Typically used to modify the kanji field’s name (e.g. “Yomi Last Name” specifies how to correctly pronounce/sort/group “Last Name”). The main distinction compared to “phonetic” is that sorting/grouping behavior is expected to be impacted for “yomi”, but not for “phonetic”.
A feature that provides a progressive disclosure method that remains active only as long as the user holds (presses down) their finger on the touch surface.
The charm that provides access to the devices commands.
A hardware button that increases and decreases the sound volume.
The UI label that indicates a screen or monitor that is attached to a PC and that content can be projected on to.
An interface that enables a web application server (for example, Office Web Apps Server) to access and change files that are stored by a host server (such as SharePoint Server).

A web application server, such as Office Web Apps Server, that uses WOPI and WOPI conventions to integrate with a host server, and is designed to view and edit files stored by the host.
A host server, such as SharePoint Server, that uses WOPI to support file operations and provides a wrapper for the WOPI application UI.
An application that comes with a product key and DVD that allows users them to purchase Windows and activate their current copy of Windows from the client.
A SharePoint site to which an app is installed.
A subweb site to which the SharePoint components of an app are deployed when the app is installed on a host web.
To deploy the components of an app on appropriate hosts and establish app isolation automatically.
A report generated by OEMs for each OA 3.0 manufactured computer which is then sent to Microsoft for processing. This report includes the hardware hash value and Product Key ID.
A report generated by OEMs for each OA 3.0 manufactured computer which is then sent to Microsoft for processing. This report includes the hardware hash value and Product Key ID.
An Internet application that runs on smartphones and other portable devices.
A SharePoint field type that enables annotation of a SharePoint list with latitude and longitude.
A SharePoint view that provides an optimized mobile browser experience for users and renders in HTML5.
A SharePoint view that renders in HTML format, or a similar markup language such as CHTML or WML, and provides backward compatibility for mobile browsers that cannot support the contemporary view.
The location where Active Directory directory service objects, such as users and groups, are mastered (an original source that defines copies of an object) in a cross-premises deployment.

A web-based meeting scheduling and management tool for users who don’t have access to Microsoft Outlook, or are on an operating system not based on Windows. With Lync Web Scheduler, you can create new meetings, change your existing meetings, and send invitations using your favorite email program.
A SharePoint feature that enables a single publishing site to be rendered differently for different mobile devices in order to optimize the user experience.

A deployment model in which part of a tenant organization's mailboxes, files, or other services, are hosted and part of them are not hosted but instead exist in the organization's own on-premises deployment.
A provider that offers DNS hosting services.
A domain, website, or other directory whose name consists of a single chunk, such as "contoso," without a suffix such as .com, .corp, .net, .org.
To lock specific rows or columns in place in order to keep them in view while scrolling in a worksheet.
To release nonscrolling panes within a worksheet.
The version of software that's distributed to manufacturers to build into hardware they will make available when the final software is made generally available.
The version of software that's distributed to manufacturers to build into hardware they will make available when the final software is made generally available.
To reset a system using a method that restores PC settings to defaults but retains a user's files and personalization touches.
To reset a system so that all user customizations are removed.

A software package that makes updated management functionality available for installation in Windows and Windows Server. Windows Management Framework includes updated features and functionalities in components such as Windows PowerShell, Windows Remote Management (WinRM), and Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI).
The service run by the Windows Store team that supports the end-to-end process for registering Windows Store developers and onboarding apps into the Windows Store catalog.
The service run by the Windows Store team that supports the end-to-end process for registering Windows Store developers and onboarding apps into the Windows Store catalog.

termGrp.term: tauler de la Botiga del Windows

descripGrp.descrip: A control that slows down the speed of panning from a user interaction.
The button that allows customers to finalize their purchase on a website.
An authentication protocol between two servers or services.
An authentication protocol between two servers or services.
A test of knowledge that consists of a series of short questions, often in a multiple-choice format.
A number or code that an educational institution uses to identify a particular class.
A targeted search experience that displays results that are custom filtered and formatted for a specific content type or class, such as people or videos.
The out-of-the-box encryption capabilities that are automatically included on PCs running Windows RT.

The feature of Bing that enables customers to block sites containing adult (sexually explicit) content. Customers can choose from three levels of filtering: strict (hides adult text and image results); moderate (hides adult images only); and off (doesn't hide any search results).
The preferred term for mature content. Don't use "explicit" or “sexually explicit.”
A search feature that allows users to build robust, targeted queries that include search operators.
Search suggestions appear when a user types in the search box. Do not use "autosuggest"
A feature in Bing Maps that provides high-resolution aerial imagery of locations photographed from north, south, east, and west, providing four actual views of a point.
A feature that provides image results that are easy to browse without having to click to a new page.

The ratio of the earned value (EV), which is sometimes referred to as the budgeted cost of work performed (BCWP), to the planned value (PV), which is sometimes referred to as the budgeted cost of work scheduled (BCWS). SPI is often used to estimate the project completion date. The SPI value is calculated as follows: SPI = EV/PV. If the resulting SPI value is less than 1.0, that indicates that less work was completed on the project than was planned. If the SPI value is 1.0 or greater, that indicates that more work was completed than was planned.
A picture, shape, or video effect that uses gradation as opposed to a hard outline. The edges of the object disappear or fade into the background.

A set of web services built on top of the Office 365 platform that makes available Office 365 components or data, such as documents, spreadsheets, presentations, calendars, mail, contacts, and tasks. A user account and associated credentials that is used to access Microsoft’s and 3rd parties’ business services, such as Office 365. Work or school accounts are usually assigned to end users by their organization (work, school, non-profit) and managed by the admin. However, some business services like Yammer support work or school accounts that were created by end users, without IT involvement. We sometimes refer to these accounts as “viral” AAD accounts but we don’t use this term externally. Work or school accounts are stored in Azure Active Directory (AAD) and managed by Microsoft on behalf of the organization. One of the key difference with a Microsoft account is that users don’t own the account and will typically loose access to it if they leave the organization. Other aspects like password policies are imposed by admins.

A user account and associated credentials that is used to access Microsoft’s and 3rd parties’ business services, such as Office 365. Work or school accounts are usually assigned to end users by their organization (work, school, non-profit) and managed by the admin. However, some business services like Yammer support work or school accounts that were created by end users, without IT involvement. We sometimes refer to these accounts as “viral” AAD accounts but we don’t use this term externally. Work or school accounts are stored in Azure Active Directory (AAD) and managed by Microsoft on behalf of the organization. One of the key difference with a Microsoft account is that users don’t own the account and will typically loose access to it if they leave the organization. Other aspects like password policies are imposed by admins.
